The thrust of their argument , Wright explained at the ASH / ASN session , was that evidence was insufficient to make a change , that loosening the threshold would lower the intensity of antihypertensive treatment in higher - risk groups , including older individuals and blacks , and that less intensive control of blood pressure might counteract improvements that have been made in death rates from coronary heart disease and stroke .
